title: French protectorate in Morocco
summary: The French protectorate of Morocco (French: Protectorat français au Maroc; Arabic: الحماية الفرنسية في المغرب‎), also known as French Morocco, was the French military occupation of a large part of Morocco established in the form of a colonial regime imposed by France while preserving the Moroccan royal regime known as the Sherifian Empire under French rule.[4] The protectorate was officially established 30 March 1912, when Sultan Abd al-Hafid signed the Treaty of Fes, though the French military occupation of Morocco had begun with the invasion of Oujda and the bombardment of Casablanca in 1907.[4]
